#include "eol_types.h"

Data Structures

struct  eolFile

Defines

#define EOLFILEBIGENDIAN   0
 To keep the assets made by eol consistent across platforms, all saving to file will be a set Endian-nes, regardless of platform.
#define EOLFILELISTTLEENDIAN   1
#define EOLFILEENDIAN   EOLFILELISTTLEENDIAN

Enumerations

enum  eolLoaderMode { eolLoaderRead, eolLoaderReadBinary, eolLoaderWriteBinary }

Functions

void eol_loader_init ()
 sets up the physFS internal system
void eol_load_config ()
 loads config for the loader. Unlike other system config functions, this MUST be called AFTR eol_loader_init() is called.
eolBool eol_loader_initialized ()
 checks initialization status of the loader
void eol_loader_add_search_path (char *filename, char *point)
 adds a path to the search path for file loading.
eolFile * eol_loader_read_file (char *filename)
 opens a file for reading from the filesystem or a pak file
eolFile * eol_loader_write_file_binary (char *filename)
 opens a file for writing from the filesystem or a pak file
void eol_loader_close_file (eolFile **file)
 closes an eolFile handle and cleans up allocated memory
void eol_loader_write_uint_to_file (eolFile *file, eolUint data)
 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.
void eol_loader_write_int_to_file (eolFile *file, eolInt data)
 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.
void eol_loader_write_line_to_file (eolFile *file, eolLine data)
 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.
void eol_loader_write_string_to_file (eolFile *file, char *data)
 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.

 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.

 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.

 write data to an open eolFile buffer. does nothing if the file handle is NULL or opened for reading.

char *  point 
)

adds a path to the search path for file loading.

Parameters:
path the directory path "./system/paks/" or archive "./system/pak0.pak"
point optional. defaults to "./" can be provided.
